customblocker.name: Quetzlcoatl Statue
customblocker.description: A stone statue in the shape of the feathered serpent, Quetzalcoatl.

customblocker.name: Calendar Round
customblocker.description: Tracks the timing of the necessary sacrifices to keep the world from ending. Say, isn't that today's date?

customblocker.name: Quetzlcoatl Carving
customblocker.description: The feathered serpent is the god of life, light, and wisdom. Very popular with the nerdy types likely to commision huge temple construction projects.

customblocker.name: Painting of Huitzilopochtli
customblocker.description: Huitzilopochtli is the bloody god of war, fire, the sun, and hummingbirds. Also makes a mean burrito.

customblocker.name: Dirty Pictures of Tlazolteotl
customblocker.description: Tlazolteotl is the goddess of filth, sexuality, vice, purification, steam baths, lust, and a patroness of adulterers. We should all be thankful the picture is so pixelated.

action.text: Foomp! The braziers ignite. The guest of honor has arrived for the sacrifice.

customblocker.name: Ulama Goal
customblocker.description: A large stone hoop used as a goal in the world's oldest sport. No, that's not a euphemism.

customblocker.name: Ulama Goal
customblocker.description: A big stone target to smash an Ulama ball through. Before you play, you might want to ask if the losing team gets sacrificed or not. It could be important.

customblocker.name: Quetzlcoatl Carving
customblocker.description: Welcome to Aztecnology Stadium, home of the Feathered Serpent Hot Dog.

customblocker.name: Hall of Fame
customblocker.description: Each feather of the Coatl is hand-carved from stone, etched with the name of one of the legendary athletes who played and died in this very court.
